meanings.definition: The action of copying or reproducing something.
meanings.sent1: The replication of the painting was so precise that it looked identical to the original.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the replication of cells to understand how organisms grow and heal.
meanings.sent3: The replication of the recipe turned out to be a disaster when the wrong ingredient was used.
meanings.sent4: Her replication of his dance moves was so accurate, it was like watching him perform.
meanings.sent5: The replication of the experiment in different labs confirmed the initial findings.

meanings.definition: A duplicate or copy of something.
meanings.sent1: He made a replication of the key to keep as a spare in case he lost the original.
meanings.sent2: The artist's replication of the famous painting was sold as limited edition prints.
meanings.sent3: The replication of the toy car was so detailed, it was hard to tell it apart from the real one.
meanings.sent4: The replication of the ancient artifact allowed more people to appreciate its beauty.
meanings.sent5: Having a replication of the document ensured that there was always a backup available.

meanings.sent1: During cell division, DNA replication ensures that each new cell receives a complete set of genetic information.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the intricacies of DNA replication is crucial in the field of genetics.
meanings.sent3: The DNA replication process is like a molecular photocopy machine creating identical genetic copies.
meanings.sent4: DNA replication is a fundamental process that allows living organisms to pass on genetic traits.
meanings.sent5: Errors in DNA replication can lead to genetic mutations with serious consequences.
